item.name: 0. Getting Started

request.description:
This function enables any User of the Customer Organization identified by {org-id} to retrieve information about their Organization including details pertinent to the Geographic Region at which the API is targetted, which can be either their home Geographic Region or any another Geographic Region enabled for their Organization.
Key details returned include the Organization's home Geographic Region and its current VPN Access setting, and the VPN Access state at the time of the request

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 22.1

This API call retrieves Geographic Region information for the user and org id provided with the call

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 2.1

This function identifies the list of Data Centers available to the organization ({org-id}) of the authenticating user and the attributes associated each Data Center

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 2.3

A Network Domain is the fundamental building block for your MCP 2.0 Cloud deployment. At least one Network Domain and one VLAN must be deployed before you can deploy your first Server in an MCP 2.0 data center.

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 3.1

Lists all of the Network Domains belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter. Various filter values can be used to narrow the list returned as detailed below.

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 3.2

This function deploys a VLAN on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 4.1

Lists all of the VLANs on a particular Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center, belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 4.2

Adds a block of Public IPv4 Addresses to the designated Network Domain

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 5.1

Lists all of the Public IPv4 Address Blocks belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 5.2

This function creates a NAT Rule on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 9.1

Lists all of the NAT Rules on a particular Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 9.2

This function creates a new CLIENT_RULE Firewall Rule on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.2

Lists all of the Firewall Rules on a particular Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center, belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.1

This function creates a Virtual Listener on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 12.1

Lists all of the Virtual Listeners at an MCP 2.0 data center, belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 12.2

This function deploys a new Cloud Server utilizing VMwareâ€™s Guest OS Customization process

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.1

Lists all of the Servers at the Geographic Region belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.3

This function is used to enable Snapshots for a Server identified by serverId, on a particular Service Plan

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.1

Lists the Server Snapshots for the Server identified by the serverId querystring parameter and belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.7

item.description: This folder comprises of basic API calls to get started with Cloud Control.

request.description:
This API call retrieves Geographic Region information for the user and org id provided with the call

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 2.1

This API call retrieves configuration level information specific to single geographic region

> More details located in Section 2.2

This function identifies the list of Data Centers available to the organization ({org-id}) of the authenticating user and the attributes associated each Data Center

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 2.3

List all Operating System in Geographic Region

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 2.4

Lists all of the Operating Systems (OS) Units Groups at a Geographic Region. Every OS belongs to an OS Units Group. Each OS Units Group governs what (if any) additional usage is associated with Cloud Servers deployed from Server Images that have an OS belonging to the group.

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 2.5

item.name: Get OS Units Type Per OS ID

request.description:
Retrieves a single Operating Systems (OS) Units Group at a Geographic Region

More details located in Section 2.6

Lists all of the Network Domains belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter. Various filter values can be used to narrow the list returned as detailed below.

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 3.2

A Network Domain is the fundamental building block for your MCP 2.0 Cloud deployment. At least one Network Domain and one VLAN must be deployed before you can deploy your first Server in an MCP 2.0 data center.

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 3.1

Returns details of a single Network Domain belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter.

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 3.3

This function deploys a VLAN on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 4.1

Lists all of the VLANs on a particular Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center, belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 4.2

Returns details of a single VLAN belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 4.3

Increases the scale of an Attached VLAN or Detached VLAN owned by {org-id} from one CIDR boundary to another

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 4.6

Changes the gateway address(es) for an Attached VLAN belonging to the organization identified by {org- id} from the system default(s) to User provides value(s). Doing so converts the Attached VLAN to a Detached VLAN

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 4.7

Changes the gateway address(es) for a Detached VLAN belonging to the organization identified by {org-id} from the User provides value(s) to system default(s). Doing so converts the Detached VLAN to a Attached VLAN

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 4.8

Adds a block of Public IPv4 Addresses to the designated Network Domain

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 5.1

Lists all of the Public IPv4 Address Blocks belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 5.2

item.name: Get individual IPv4 block by ipblock ID

request.description:
Returns details of a single Public IPv4 Address Block belonging to the organization identified by the {org- id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 5.3

item.name: List Reserved IPv4 Public Address by NAT

request.description:
This function reserves a Private IPv4 Address on either an MCP 1.0 Cloud Network or an MCP 2.0 VLAN for purposes not covered by automatic reservation as part of another CloudControl API function

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 5.6

This function unreserves a Private IPv4 Address on either an MCP 1.0 Cloud Network or an MCP 2.0 VLAN, which has previously been exclusively reserved using the Reserve Private IPv4 Address function

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 5.8

This function reserves an IPv6 Address on an MCP 2.0 VLAN for purposes not covered by automatic reservation as part of another CloudControl API function

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 5.9

item.name: List Reserved Private IPv6 Addresses by Vlan Id

request.description:
This function unreserves an IPv6 Address on an MCP 2.0 VLAN, which has previously been exclusively reserved using the Reserve Private IPv6 Address function

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 5.11

This function creates a new CLIENT Static Route on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 6.1

Lists all of the Static Routes for the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter.

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 6.2

Returns details of a single Static Route belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 6.3

Restores the Static Routes of a Network Domain (networkDomainId) belonging to the organization identified by {org-id} to the system default (also referred to as baseline) configuration applied when the Network Domain was first deployed

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 6.5

This function adds a new SNAT Exclusion IP range to an ENTERPRISE Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 7.1

Lists all of the SNAT Exclusions for Network Domains belonging to the organization identified by the {org- id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 7.2

Returns details of a single SNAT Exclusion corresponding to an individual Network Domain belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 7.3

Restores the SNAT Exclusions of a Network Domain (networkDomainId) belonging to the organization identified by {org-id} to the system default (also referred to as baseline) configuration applied when the Network Domain was first deployed

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 7.5

This function creates an IP Address List on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.6

Lists all of the IP Address Lists on a particular Network Domain belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.7

item.name: Get IP Address List by ID

request.description:
Returns details of a single IP Address List belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.8

This function creates a Port List on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.11

Lists all of the Port Lists on a particular Network Domain belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.12

Returns details of a single Port List belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.13

Lists all of the Firewall Rules on a particular Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center, belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.1

This function creates a new CLIENT_RULE Firewall Rule on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.2

item.name: List a firewall rule by ID

request.description:
Returns details of a single Firewall Rule belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.3

Lists statistics about each Firewall Rule on a particular Network Domain belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 8.16

This function creates a NAT Rule on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 9.1

Lists all of the NAT Rules on a particular Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 9.2

Returns details of a single NAT Rule belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 9.3

item.name: 9. VIPS - Node Management

request.description:
This function creates a Node on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 10.1

Lists all of the Nodes on a particular Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center, belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 10.2

Returns details of a single Node belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 10.3

item.description:
A Node is a low level component of a VIP and a NAT in an MCP 2.0 data center.

A Node is added to a Pool (see Create Pool) as a Pool Member (see Add Pool Member), where it can
receive designated network traffic from a Virtual Listener (see Create Virtual Listener). 

> Node Management is restricted to ADVANCED and ENTERPRISE type Network Domains.

request.description:
This function creates a Pool on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 11.1

Lists all of the Pools on a particular Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center, belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 11.2

Returns details of a single Pool belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 11.3

Adds a Node belonging to the organization identified by {org-id}, combined with Port information to the identified Pool as a new Pool Member. The Pool Member can respond to traffic directed to the Pool by a Virtual Listener, as determined by its status property

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 11.6

Lists the Pool Members on a particular Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center, belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 11.7

Returns details of a single Pool Member belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 11.8

This function creates a Virtual Listener on a Network Domain in an MCP 2.0 data center location

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 12.1

Lists all of the Virtual Listeners at an MCP 2.0 data center, belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 12.2

Returns details of a single Virtual Listener belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 12.3

Returns information about a Virtual Listener belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter, including packet counts and data statistics, detailed below in Response Details

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 12.6

This function imports an SSL Domain Certificate to a Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 Data Center

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 13.1

Lists all of the SSL Domain Certificates belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 13.2

Returns details of a single SSL Domain Certificate belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 13.3

This function adds an SSL Certificate Chain to a Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 Data Center

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 13.5

item.name: List SSL Certificate chain by CND

request.description:
Lists all of the SSL Certificate Chains belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 13.6

Returns details of a single SSL Certificate Chain belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 13.7

This function creates a new SSL Offload Profile on a Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 Data Center

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 13.9

item.name: List SSL Offload Profiles by Network Domain

request.description:
Lists all of the SSL Offload Profiles belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 13.10

item.name: Get SSL Offload Profile by ID

request.description:
Returns details of a single SSL Offload Profile belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 13.11

This function edits properties of an SSL Offload Profile on a Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 Data Center

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 13.12

Lists the default Health Monitors at an MCP 2.0 data center specific to a Network Domain (networkDomainId) belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter
This function is of relevance to Create Node, Edit Node, Create Pool and Edit Pool

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 14.1

This API function is of relevance to Create Virtual Listener and Edit Virtual Listener.
Lists the default Persistence Profiles at an MCP 2.0 data center specific to a Network Domain (networkDomainId) belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 14.2

This API function is of relevance to Create Virtual Listener and Edit Virtual Listener.
Lists the default iRules at an MCP 2.0 data center specific to a Network Domain (networkDomainId) belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 14.3

This function creates a Security Group on a Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center.
Security Groups are created in two different ways depending on intended use. If a vlanId is provided a VLAN type Security Group will be created. If a networkDomainId is provided a SERVER type Security Group will be created

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 15.1

This function creates a Security Group on a Network Domain at an MCP 2.0 data center.
Security Groups are created in two different ways depending on intended use. If a vlanId is provided a VLAN type Security Group will be created. If a networkDomainId is provided a SERVER type Security Group will be created

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 15.1

Lists all of the Security Groups on a particular VLAN, belonging to the organization identified by the {org- id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 15.2

Returns details of a single Security Group belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 15.3

item.name: Add Server to Server Security Group
Remove Server from Server Security Group

request.description:
This function deploys a new Cloud Server utilizing VMwareâ€™s Guest OS Customization process

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.1

This MCP 2.0 only function deploys a new Cloud Server from a CloudControl compatible Server Image, which does not utilize VMwareâ€™s Guest OS Customization process

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.2

Lists all of the Servers at the Geographic Region belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.3

Returns details of a single Server belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.4

Starts a non-running Server belonging to the organization identified by {org-id}. Requires the identifier {id} of the Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.6

This function performs guest OS initiated restart of a running Server belonging to the organization identified by {org-id}. Requires the identifier {id} of the Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.8

This function performs hard reset of a running Server belonging to the organization identified by {org-id}. Requires the identifier {id} of the Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.9

This function performs hard power off of a running Server belonging to the organization identified by {org- id}. Requires the identifier {id} of the Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.10

This function updates metadata associated with a Server belonging to the organization ({org-id})

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.11

This function returns the configuration of a Server at specific points in time. A Server's configuration may change over time as Users modify the Server during its lifecycle, for example an update to CPU count or RAM

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.13

Initiates a clone of a Server to create a new Customer Image

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.14

This MCP 2.0 only function initiates a move of a Server to a different cluster within the same Data Center. This function applies only to multiple cluster environments (see List Data Centers)

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.15

This function moves a storage volume (referred to as Disk) for a Server belonging to the organization identified by {org-id} to a different speed storage tier

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.18

This function changes the level of IOPS for a Disk belonging to the organization identified by {org-id}. The Disk must have a variable IOPS disk speed, identifiable by variableIops=true for the Disk. Requires the identifier {id} of the Disk

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.19

This function triggers an update of the VMware Tools software running on the guest OS of a Server belonging to the organization identified by {org-id}. Requires the identifier {id} of the Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.25

Lists all of the NICs belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter on the VLAN identified by the required vlanId filter parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.29

Exchanges the VLANs between two NICs a single MCP 2.0 Server belonging to the organization identified by {org-id}. Requires the UUID of both NICs

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.30

item.name: Notify System of NIC IP address change

request.description:
On occasion manual intervention on a deployed Server or a API 0.9 Restore Backup for Server (Out of Place) operation can require that an IP Address changes from the one assigned when it was originally deployed to a different IP address within the same subnet. This API function updates the CloudControl record to match the value already set on the deployed Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.33

This function is used to remove a failed Server Deployment. Failed Server deployments are visible as Servers in the List Servers response with the value "FAILED_ADD" for their state property

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.34

Creates a new Server Anti-Affinity Rule between two Servers on the same Cloud Network (MCP 1.0) or Network Domain (MCP 2.0)

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.35

Lists the Server Anti-Affinity rules between Servers on a Network Domain belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.36

This MCP 1.0 only API initiates the process of copying a Server from an MCP 1.0 Data Center to an MCP 2.0 Data Center at the same Geographic Region

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 16.38

Enables Primary Administrator and Server users to manage vApp Properties on Servers

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 15.39

Disables vApp Properties for Server serverId belonging to Organization {org-id} by doing the following:
- Removes any vApp Properties schemas, keys and values relating to the Server.
- Removes associated VMware Transport and ISO Transport settings.
- Removes the vApp specific ISO file if any exists

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 15.40

item.name: 16. Snapshots

request.description:
Lists all of the Snapshot Windows at a Data Center and their attributes

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.16

This function is used to enable Snapshots for a Server identified by serverId, on a particular Service Plan

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.1

This function disables the Snapshots for a given Server (identified by serverId) and removes any previously generated Snapshots present on the system for the Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.2

This API function enables a User to switch between Snapshots service plans for a Server previously enabled for Snapshots with Enable Snapshots for a Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.3

This function requests that the system begins creating a Snapshot for a Server (identified by serverId). The Snapshot is created independently of the scheduled System Snapshots for the Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.4

This function allows a user to change the Pre-Snapshot Script and/or Post-Snapshot Script associated with a Snapshots enabled Server, and/or the Server credentials associated with their execution

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.5

This function deletes a Manual Snapshot (identified by id) for the Organization {org-id}. It is not possible to delete a System Snapshot

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.6

Lists the Server Snapshots for the Server identified by the serverId querystring parameter and belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.7

Returns the Snapshot identified by {snapshot-id} belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.8

This function creates a new Server based on a Manual or System Snapshot (identified by snapshotId) of an existing Snapshot enabled Server.
The Server will have a deploymentMode of SNAPSHOT_PREVIEW to indicate its status with respect to the source Snapshot

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.9

This function migrates a Snapshot Preview Server previously created using Create Snapshot Preview Server to become a Server. The target Server is identified by its UUID serverId

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.10

This function enables a User to identify a specific file or directory on a Server Snapshot for restoration to a specific destination on the Server from which the Snapshot originated

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.11

This function updates the metadata associated with a Snapshot identified by id (see List Snapshots)

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.12

This function allows a Primary Administrator or Server role User to switch on replication of SYSTEM Snapshots for a Server already enabled for Snapshots. The User must provide a replication target Data Center (retrieved using List Data Centers) in the request

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.13

This function disables Snapshot Replication for a Server (identified by serverId) that has previously been enabled for Snapshot Service and replication

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.14

This function creates a new Server based on a replicated System Snapshot (identified by replicatedSnapshotId) of an existing Snapshot enabled Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.15

Lists the set of Snapshot Service Plans at the Geographic Region and their attributes

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 17.17

item.description: This folder includes all API call pertaining to Server Snapshot feature

request.description:
This function is used to enable Monitoring for a Server on a particular Service Plan

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 18.1

This function is used to change the Monitoring Service Plan for a Server that has Monitoring already enabled

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 18.2

This function is used to disable Monitoring for a Cloud Server

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 18.3

In order to create a DRS Consistency Group (see Create Consistency Group), which is the fundamental unit of DRS, at least one pair of compatible source and target Servers is required.
This API enables Primary Administrator and DRS role Users to shorten the process of creating a suitably matching target Server by indicating a source Server, which CloudControl will use to produce a compatible copy

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.1

This function is used to create a new DRS Consistency Group, which is the fundamental unit of DRS.
The Consistency Group binds pairs of *DRS eligible Servers to facilitate DRS protection. It is comprised of a set of Server pairs. Each Server pair contains a source Server and a target Server.

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.2

Lists all of the Consistency Groups belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter at the Geographic Region. Various filter values can be used to narrow the list returned as detailed below.

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.3

Retrieves details of an individual Consistency Group belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter at the Geographic Region

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.4

item.name: Set DRS Re IP Address Rules

request.description:
This API enables Primary Administrator and DRS role Users to define a set of rules that will be applied to the NICs of a target Server in a DRS Consistency Group Server Pair. These rules reduce the configuration time required when a failover scenario takes place by allowing users to have the correct IP Addressing and additional networking configuration detailed below already defined, and automatically applied by the system

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.6

item.name: Delete DRS Re IP Address Rules

request.description:
This API removes all of the Re-IP Address Rules for the Target Server of a single Server Pair in a Consistency Group belonging to the organization identified by {org-id}.

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.7

Lists all of the Snapshots in a particular time period for a Consistency Group belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter. The Snapshots are returned in date descending order (latest first)

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.8

This function is used to expand the Journal size available for a DRS Consistency Group.
The Journal is comprised of extents, each of which is up to 1000GB in size. The amount by which the Journal is to be increased must be provided in 100GB increments. The amount by which you increase the Journal will be divided into the appropriate number of extents up to a maximum total size permitted

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.9

Start Failover Preview for Consistency Group brings a snapshot of a Consistency Group into preview mode at the target Data Center

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.10

Stop Failover Preview for Consistency Group brings a snapshot of a Consistency Group from preview back to DRS mode (DRS_MODE operationStatus). This returns the target Servers from representing the snapshot state and configuration to dormant DRS configuration

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.11

Initiate Failover for Consistency Group commits failover of the snapshot state previously applied to the target Servers of the Consistency Group by the Start Failover Preview for Consistency Group function.
Proceed with extreme caution because this process is irreversible

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.12

This API enables Primary Administrator and DRS role Users to remove Consistency Groups that are in particular failed states (see Get Consistency Group for state)

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 19.13

Customer Images are Server Image created by a User of the Organization identified by {org-id} through any of several means including but not limited to Clone Server, Import OVF Package as Customer Image or Copy Image to Data Center

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 20.3

This API function allows an integrator to update the metadata associated with one of the Customer Images owned by the organization identified by {org-id}. This API function updates CloudControl's metadata records only. It does not have any effect on the hypervisor

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 20.5

This MCP 2.0 only function initiates a move of a Customer Image to a different cluster within the same Data Center. This function applies only to multiple cluster environments (see List Data Centers)

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 20.8

This function initiates a copy of a Customer Image to another Data Center within the same Geographic Region

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 20.9

This function creates a new Customer Image from an OVF Package saved in the FTPS account of the Organization identified by {org-id}. This API function is also referred to as "Import Customer Image"

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 20.10

Lists the OVF Packages in the FTPS account belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 20.11

Paged and filtered list of completed Customer Image Exports that have been carried out by the organization identified by {org-id}. The list includes any that may have completed unsuccessfully as well as those that have completed successfully

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 20.13

This function creates a new Tag Key for the given Organization. The user can decide to make the Tag Key visible on reports at the point of creation or afterwards using the Edit Tag Key API function

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 21.1

Lists all of the Tag Keys belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 21.2

Applies a single or multiple Tags to a Cloud asset for the organization identified by {org-id}.
A Tag is a combination of a Tag Key and a Value, which might or might not be optional depending on the
Tag Key being referenced (see Create Tag Key)

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 21.6

Lists all of the Tags belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 21.7

This function enables any User of the Customer Organization identified by {org-id} to retrieve information about their Organization including details pertinent to the Geographic Region at which the API is targetted, which can be either their home Geographic Region or any another Geographic Region enabled for their Organization.
Key details returned include the Organization's home Geographic Region and its current VPN Access setting, and the VPN Access state at the time of the request

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 22.1

This function enables the Primary Administrator for the Organization identified by {org-id} to update the Organization's account at a single Geographic Region to use one of the VPN Access settings available at the region

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 22.2

This API is User Interface specific and does not change Authentication behavior of the CloudControl API

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 22.3

This function creates a new User for the given Organization and must be called against the home Geographic Region for the Organization. If unknown, the home Geographic Region can be identified by calling the My User API with Primary Administrator credentials

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.1

Allows a User to retrieve their own details, including their roles, a summary of their Organization and the Geographic Region their Organization is homed at.
This API is a useful way of retrieving the Organization's UUID ({org-id}) used in the URL for most of the API functions in this documentation

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.2

Allows the Primary Administrator user to list all of the Users belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.3

Allows the Primary Administrator User to retrieve details about any User belonging to their Organization

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.4

This function is used to update properties for a User of the given Organization.
It must be executed against the home Geographic Region for the Organization. If unknown, the home
Geographic Region can be determined by calling the My User API with Primary Administrator credentials

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.5

This function enables a Primary Administrator User to replace the set of roles associated with a User of the given Organization.
It must be executed against the home Geographic Region for the Organization. If unknown, the home Geographic Region can be determined by calling the My User API

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.6

This function enables a Primary Administrator to change the password associated with a User of the given Organization or any User to change their own password.
It must be executed against the home Geographic Region for the Organization. If unknown, the home Geographic Region can be determined by calling the My User API

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.7

This function enables a Primary Administrator to delete a Sub-Administrator User for the given Organization.
It must be executed against the home Geographic Region for the Organization. If unknown, the home Geographic Region can be determined by calling the My User API

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.8

Duo is the system used for processing Multi-Factor VPN Authentication when Multi-Factor VPN Access has been enabled for an Organization ({org-id}) at a particular Geographic Region using the Set VPN Access API

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.9

Allows a user to retrieve VPN session information about one or more Users belonging to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.10

Retrieves VPN session information for a User identified by the {userName} parameter. The {userName} in the URL parameter and the authenticating User must both* belong to the organization identified by the {org-id} parameter

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.11

This function creates a new Webhook for the given Organization with a specific callbackUrl API endpoint, which CloudControl will notify when actions occur

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.2

Each webhook is not active by default (see Webhook Overview and Create Webhook).
This API allows the User to complete the process by sending in the shared secret received on the callback URL provided in the Create Webhook request.
This API also allows a User to reactivate a webhook that has been disabled through the use of Deactivate Webhook

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.3

This API allows the User to deactivate one of the webhooks belonging to their organization.  
This function does not delete the webhook immediately, instead a cleanup operation will automatically
delete the webhook after a period of 30 days if it is not reactivated by calling Activate Webhook

##### Request Properties:
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.4

Retrieves details about a webhook belonging to {org-id} along with some summary statistical information.

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 23.5

This function returns the Monitoring Usage Report at the given geographic region for the organization identified by {org-id}, limited (inclusively) to the supplied date range input parameters. The report is returned in Comma Separated Value (CSV) format

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 24.1

Provides a CSV-formatted usage report explaining how the OS Units usage was calculated for the organization ({org-id}) in the defined period

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 24.2

Provides a CSV-formatted usage report explaining how the DRS Pairs (â€œDRS Source Server Hoursâ€) usage was calculated for the organization ({org-id}) in the defined period

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 24.3

Provides a CSV-formatted usage report explaining how the Snapshot (â€œ<type> Snapshot Hoursâ€) usage was calculated for the organization ({org-id}) in the defined period for the relevant Server and Snapshot Plan

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 24.4

Provides a CSV-formatted usage report explaining how Security Group usage (as â€œSecurity Group Hoursâ€) was calculated for the organization ({org-id}) in the defined period

##### Filter Optional Parameters: 
> Refer Cloud Control REST API Documentation Section 24.5
